intro: Castanopsis hsiensiui, commonly known as the Hsiensui tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to southern China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny cupule. It thrives in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Castanopsis hsiensiui plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
